resources.string: Place the sample in the measuring kit and press the "Record" button.
Configures sample region bounds. Also sets defaults for the calibration curve if no calibration has been performed.
Place a sample in the measuring kit and align the sample region (red box) with the sample layer, then press "Finish".
Performs a one-point calibration. Requires a 0ppb reference sample.
Step 1: Place a sample in the measuring kit and align the sample region (red box) with the sample layer, then press "Next".
Step 2: Place a 0 ppb sample in the measuring kit and press "Record".
Performs a two-point calibration. Requires a 50ppb and 500ppb reference samples.
Step 1: Place a sample in the measuring kit and align the sample region (red box) with the sample layer, then press "Next".
Step 2: Place a 50 ppb sample in the measuring kit and press "Record".
Step 3: Place a 500 ppb sample in the measuring kit and press "Record".
Performs a three-point calibration. Requires a 0ppb, 50ppb and 500ppb reference samples.
Step 1: Place a sample in the measuring kit and align the sample region (red box) with the sample layer, then press "Next".
Step 2: Place a 0 ppb sample in the measuring kit and press "Record".
Step 2: Place a 50 ppb sample in the measuring kit and press "Record".
Step 4: Place a 500 ppb sample in the measuring kit and press "Record".
Allows you to configure the default calibration

The fields below allow you to override the \'defaults\' used for the calibration curve when a zero, one, or two-point calibration is performed.\n\nUnder normal circumstances they should not need to be overridden, and doing so may lead to calibration issues and/or incorrect sample values.
For additional information, review the User Guide and Q&A provided with the testing kit (also available on the astkCARE website).
Sorry, you can\'t use this app without granting permission.
